Package SpaceShooterV3.gameObjects

Class Shot

java.lang.Object
SpaceShooterV3.gameObjects.SpaceCharacter
SpaceShooterV3.gameObjects.Shot
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Shot extends SpaceCharacter implements Serializable
A Shot is a SpaceCharacter that can be serialized

    • goUp

      public boolean goUp

  • Constructor Details

    • Shot

      public Shot()
      This is the default constructor for the Shot class. It is calling the default constructor for the SpaceCharacter class.

    • Shot

      public Shot(int x, int y, int w, int h, int s, String u)
      This is the constructor for the Shot class. It is calling the constructor for the SpaceCharacter class and then setting the y coordinate to 600 and the goUp variable to false.

  • Method Details

    • move

      public void move(int direcation)
      If the y coordinate of the object is less than 0, then set the y coordinate to 600 and set the goUp variable to false. If the goUp variable is true, then subtract the speed from the y coordinate
      Specified by:
      move in class SpaceCharacter
      Parameters:
      direcation - The direction the player is moving in.

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics window)
      The draw function draws the image of the object at the x and y coordinates of the object
      Specified by:
      draw in class SpaceCharacter
      Parameters:
      window - the Graphics object that you will draw on

    • SetLeftRight

      public void SetLeftRight(int d)
      If the key pressed is the left arrow key, set the moveLeft boolean to true. If the key pressed is the right arrow key, set the moveRight boolean to true
      Parameters:
      d - The keycode of the key that was pressed.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      If the player is moving left, stop moving left.
